result.execSummary:
The defendant James Lavell Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Room w/in Building, etc., a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(f).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds   under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes:
Seek and maintain full time employment.
Complete a job training program to enhance ability to obtain employment.
Cooperate and particpate with a mental health evaluation.  Follow any recommended treatment.

Comply with the standard rules of Extended Supervision.
Take any and all medications as prescribed.
Cooperate and participate with a AODA assessment.  Follow any recommended treatment.    Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Restitution amounts of:  $785.00 payable to Mary H.; $1,000.00 payable to Doc P., ; $60.00 payable to Church of Good Hope.  (Assessments are showing/accessed on 14CF676)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Lavell Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (29 pages) commencing DECEMBER 15, 2014 received and filed. kl

Defendant James Lavell Johnson in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant James Lavell Johnson in custody.  Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. No changes made to the PSI or the Sentencing Memorandum.  Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statements made by:  victim's daughter/defendant's aunt, Dorothy F.; defendant's brother, Antonio J.

AS TO COUNT 1:    The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 5 YEARS, concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS.
Credit for 271 days time served.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligibile for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* Take any and all medications as prescribed.
* Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Seek and maintain full time employment.
* Complete a job training program to enhance ability to obtain employment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.    The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $785.00 payable to Mary H.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $1,000.00 payable to Doc P.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
PAY restitution in the amount of $60.00 payable to Church of Good Hope.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Letter to Judge Donald; from the defendant.
SENTENCING MEMORANDUM prepared and filed by Public Defender's Office Client Services Specialist, Ana Maria Guzman.
for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI); signed and filed.  Copy forwarded to the Probation Department for processing.

Defendant James Lavell Johnson in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant James Lavell Johnson IN CUSTODY.  Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

**Court ordered a PSI with a recommendation.

Case adjourned to 12-15-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

Defendant James Lavell Johnson in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant James Lavell Johnson in custody.  Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Christopher B. and Marquette University.

Defendant James Lavell Johnson in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant James Lavell Johnson in custody.  Gary D Mahkorn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.
